conclusion: Determine the time t1 it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder after being released from rest.
The wooden rod is 5 meters long.
The cylinder AB is 5 meters tall.
The distance from the suspension point to the top of the cylinder A is 20 meters.
The total distance from the suspension point to the bottom of the cylinder B is 25 meters.
Let t be the total time taken for the rod to fall from the suspension point to the bottom of the cylinder.
Use the equation of motion under gravity: d = (1/2) g t^2.
Substitute d = 25 m and g = 10 m/s^2 into the equation to get 25 = 5t^2.
Solve for t to get t = sqrt(5) seconds.
The rod's bottom end will pass through A when it has fallen 20 meters.
Let t1 be the time taken for the rod's bottom to reach A.
Substitute d = 20 m and g = 10 m/s^2 into the equation to get 20 = 5t1^2.
Solve for t1 to get t1 = sqrt(4) seconds.
The time t1 it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder is 2 seconds.
